017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.io.Serializable;
020
021import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
022import java.lang.reflect.Executable;
023import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
024import java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration;
025import java.lang.reflect.Method;
026import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
027import java.lang.reflect.Type;
028import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
029import java.lang.reflect.WildcardType;
030
031import java.util.ArrayList;
032import java.util.Arrays;
033import java.util.Collection;
034import java.util.Collections;
035import java.util.HashSet;
036import java.util.List;
037import java.util.Objects;
038import java.util.Set;
039import java.util.StringJoiner;
040
041import java.util.function.Predicate;
042
043/**
044 * A utility class providing useful operations related to Java {@link
045 * Type}s.
046 *
047 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
048 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
049 */
050public final class JavaTypes {
051
052  private static final Type[] EMPTY_TYPE_ARRAY = new Type[0];
053
054  /**
055   * Returns a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}.
056   *
057   * @return a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}
058   *
059   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
060   *
061   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic
062   *
063   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
064   * threads.
065   */
066  public static final Type[] emptyTypeArray() {
067    return EMPTY_TYPE_ARRAY;
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Returns the <em>direct supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
072   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
073   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
074   * TypeVariable}.
075   *
076   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type
077   * itself.</p>
078   *
079   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
080   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
081   * implementation.</p>
082   *
083   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
084   * null}
085   *
086   * @return a {@link Collection} of the direct supertypes of the
087   * supplied {@code type}; never {@code null}
088   *
089   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
090   *
091   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
092   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
093   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
094   *
095   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
096   *
097   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
098   *
099   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
100   * threads.
101   */
102  public static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final Type type) {
103    if (Objects.requireNonNull(type) instanceof Class<?> c) {
104      return directSupertypes(c);
105    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
106      return directSupertypes(p);
107    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
108      return directSupertypes(g);
109    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
110      return directSupertypes(tv);
111    } else {
112      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
113    }
114  }
115
116  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final Class<?> c) {
117    if (c == Object.class) {
118      return List.of();
119    } else if (c.isPrimitive()) {
120      // 4.10.1. Subtyping among Primitive Types
121      //
122      // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
123      // among the primitive types:
124      //
125      // double >₁ float
126      //
127      // float >₁ long
128      //
129      // long >₁ int
130      //
131      // int >₁ char
132      //
133      // int >₁ short
134      //
135      // short >₁ byte
136      //
137      // [We skip all this.]
138      return List.of();
139    } else {
140      final Collection<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
141      final Class<?> componentType = c.getComponentType();
142      if (componentType == null) {
143        final Type[] parameters = c.getTypeParameters();
144        if (parameters.length > 0) {
145          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
146          //
147          // […]
148          //
149          // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
150          // F₁,…,Fₙ (𝑛 > 0), the direct supertypes of the [this]
151          // raw type C (§4.8) are all of the following:
152          //
153          // The erasure (§4.6) of the direct superclass type of C, if
154          // C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
155          //
156          // The erasure of the direct superinterface types of C.
157          //
158          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
159          // superinterface types.
160          final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = c.getSuperclass(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
161          if (directSuperclassTypeErasure != null) {
162            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassTypeErasure);
163          }
164          final Class<?>[] directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures = c.getInterfaces(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
165          if (directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures.length > 0) {
166            for (final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure : directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures) {
167              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure);
168            }
169          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
170            assert directSuperclassTypeErasure == null;
171            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
172          }
173        } else {
174          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
175          //
176          // Given a non-generic class or interface C, the direct
177          // supertypes of the type of C are all of the following:
178          //
179          // The direct superclass type of C (§8.1.4), if C is a class.
180          //
181          // The direct superinterface types of C (§8.1.5, §9.1.3).
182          //
183          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
184          // superinterface types (§9.1.3).
185          final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass(); // let the JDK construct what may be either a Class or a ParameterizedType
186          if (directSuperclassType != null) {
187            assert (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType;
188            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassType);
189          }
190          final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces(); // let the JDK construct what may be either Class or ParameterizedType instances
191          if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
192            for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
193              assert (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType;
194              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceType);
195            }
196          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
197            assert directSuperclassType == null;
198            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
199          }
200        }
201      } else {
202        // 4.10.3. Subtyping among Array Types
203        //
204        // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
205        // among array types:
206        //
207        // If S and T are both reference types, then S[] >₁ T[] iff
208        // S >₁ T.
209        //
210        // Object >₁ Object[]
211        //
212        // Cloneable >₁ Object[]
213        //
214        // java.io.Serializable >₁ Object[]
215        //
216        // If P is a primitive type, then:
217        //
218        // Object >₁ P[]
219        //
220        // Cloneable >₁ P[]
221        //
222        // java.io.Serializable >₁ P[]
223        if (componentType == Object.class || componentType.isPrimitive()) {
224          // Object[] or, say, int[]
225          directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
226          directSupertypes.add(Cloneable.class);
227          directSupertypes.add(Serializable.class);
228        } else {
229          // Reference type (which could be a Class or a ParameterizedType).
230          for (final Type componentTypeDirectSupertype : directSupertypes(componentType)) {
231            directSupertypes.add(array(componentTypeDirectSupertype));
232          }
233        }
234      }
235      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
236    }
237  }
238
239  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final ParameterizedType p) {
240    final Collection<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
241    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
242    //
243    // […]
244    //
245    // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
246    // F₁,…,Fₙ (𝑛 > 0), the direct supertypes of the parameterized
247    // type C<T₁,…,Tₙ>, where each of Tᵢ (1 ≤ 𝑖 ≤ 𝑛) is a type, are
248    // all of the following:
249    //
250    // The substitution [F₁:=T₁,…,Fₙ:=Tₙ] applied to the direct
251    // superclass type of C, if C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
252    //
253    // The substitution [F₁:=T₁,…,Fₙ:=Tₙ] applied to the direct
254    // superinterface types of C.
255    //
256    // C<S₁,…,Sₙ>, where Sᵢ contains Tᵢ (1 ≤ 𝑖 ≤ 𝑛) (§4.5.1) [we're
257    // going to skip this].
258    //
259    // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
260    // superinterface types.
261    //
262    // The raw type C.
263    final Class<?> c = erase(p.getRawType());
264    final Type[] typeArguments = p.getActualTypeArguments();
265    final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass();
266    if (directSuperclassType != null) {
267      if (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
268        final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
269        assert directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
270        assert typeArguments.length == directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
271        directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperclassTypeErasure, typeArguments));
272      } else if (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericClass) {
273        assert nonGenericClass.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
274        directSupertypes.add(nonGenericClass);
275      } else {
276        throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType);
277      }
278    }
279    final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces();
280    if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
281      for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
282        if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
283          final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
284          assert directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
285          assert typeArguments.length == directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
286          directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure, typeArguments));
287        } else if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericInterface) {
288          assert nonGenericInterface.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
289          directSupertypes.add(nonGenericInterface);
290        } else {
291          throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType);
292        }
293      }
294    } else if (c.isInterface()) {
295      assert directSuperclassType == null;
296      directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
297    }
298    directSupertypes.add(c);
299    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
300  }
301
302  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final GenericArrayType g) {
303    final Collection<Type> genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes = directSupertypes(g.getGenericComponentType());
304    final Collection<Type> returnValue = new ArrayList<>(genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes.size());
305    for (final Type ds : genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes) {
306      returnValue.add(array(ds));
307    }
308    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(returnValue);
309  }
310
311  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
312    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
313    //
314    // […]
315    //
316    // The direct supertypes of a type variable are the types listed
317    // in its bound.
318    return List.of(tv.getBounds());
319  }
320
321  /**
322   * Returns the <em>supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
323   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
324   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
325   * TypeVariable}.
326   *
327   * <p><strong>The supertypes of a type include the type
328   * itself.</strong></p>
329   *
330   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
331   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
332   * implementation.</p>
333   *
334   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
335   * null}
336   *
337   * @return a {@link Collection} of the supertypes of the supplied
338   * {@code type}; never {@code null}
339   *
340   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
341   *
342   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
343   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
344   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
345   *
346   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
347   *
348   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
349   *
350   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
351   * threads.
352   */
353  public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type) {
354    return supertypes(type, new HashSet<>()::add);
355  }
356
357  private static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type, final Predicate<? super JavaType> unseen) {
358    if (unseen.test(JavaType.of(type))) {
359      final Collection<Type> supertypes = new ArrayList<>();
360      supertypes.add(type); // reflexive
361      for (final Type ds : directSupertypes(type)) {
362        supertypes.addAll(supertypes(ds, unseen)); // transitive/recursive
363      }
364      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(supertypes);
365    } else {
366      return List.of();
367    }
368  }
369
370  /**
371   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
372   * {@code sub}.
373   *
374   * <p>This method obeys the <a
375   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10"
376   * target="_parent">subtyping rules from the Java Language
377   * Specification</a> with the following exceptions:</p>
378   *
379   * <ul>
380   *
381   * <li><a
382   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1"
383   * target="_parent">Containing types</a> are discarded when
384   * calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.</li>
385   *
386   * <li>{@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() Primitive types} have no
387   * supertypes.</li>
388   *
389   * </ul>
390   *
391   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
392   *
393   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
394   *
395   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
396   * {@code sub}
397   *
398   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code
399   * null}
400   *
401   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
402   *
403   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
404   * threads.
405   *
406   * @see #supertypes(Type)
407   */
408  public static final boolean supertype(final Type sup, final Type sub) {
409    // Is sup a supertype of sub?
410    if (sup == null) {
411      throw new NullPointerException("sup");
412    } else if (sub == null) {
413      throw new NullPointerException("sub");
414    } else if (equals(sup, sub)) {
415      return true;
416    } else if (sup instanceof Class<?> supC && sub instanceof Class<?> subC) {
417      // Easy optimization
418      return supC.isAssignableFrom(subC);
419    } else {
420      for (final Type supertype : supertypes(sub, new HashSet<>()::add)) {
421        if (equals(supertype, sup)) {
422          return true;
423        }
424      }
425    }
426    return false;
427  }
428
429  private static final Type array(final Type type) {
430    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-10.html#jls-10.1
431    // 10.1 Array Types
432    // …
433    // The element type of an array may be any type, whether
434    // primitive or reference.
435    // …
436    // [That rules out wildcards, but nothing else.]
437    if (type == null) {
438      throw new NullPointerException("type");
439    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
440      return c.arrayType();
441    } else if (!(type instanceof WildcardType)) {
442      return new DefaultGenericArrayType(type);
443    } else {
444      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
445    }
446  }
447
448  static final boolean isReferenceType(final Type type) {
449    // Wildcards are ruled out by the BNF in
450    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1
451    return !(type == null || type instanceof WildcardType || (type instanceof Class<?> c && c.isPrimitive()));
452  }
453
454  /**
455   * Returns the type erasure for the supplied {@link Type} according
456   * to <a
457   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6"
458   * target="_parent">the rules of the Java Language
459   * Specification, section 4.6</a>.
460   *
461   * <ul>
462   *
463   * <li>If {@code null} is supplied, {@code null} is returned.</li>
464   *
465   * <li>If a {@link Class} is supplied, the {@link Class} is returned.</li>
466   *
467   * <li>If a {@link ParameterizedType} is supplied, the result of
468   * invoking {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
469   * ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type} is returned.</li>
470   *
471   * <li>If a {@link GenericArrayType} is supplied, the result of
472   * invoking {@link Object#getClass()} on an invocation of {@link
473   * java.lang.reflect.Array#newInstance(Class, int)} with the return
474   * value of an invocation of {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
475   * GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType() generic component
476   * type} and {@code 0} as its arguments is returned.</li>
477   *
478   * <li>If a {@link TypeVariable} is supplied, the result of invoking
479   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
480   * TypeVariable#getBounds() first (leftmost) bound}</strong> is
481   * returned (if it has one) or {@link Object Object.class} if it
482   * does not.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
483   *
484   * <li>If a {@link WildcardType} is supplied, the result of invoking
485   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
486   * WildcardType#getUpperBounds() first upper bound}</strong> is
487   * returned.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
488   *
489   * </ul>
490   *
491   * @param type the {@link Type} for which the corresponding type
492   * erasure is to be returned; may be {@code null} in which case
493   * {@code null} will be returned
494   *
495   * @return a {@link Class}, or {@code null} if a suitable {@link
496   * Class}-typed type erasure could not be determined, indicating
497   * that the type erasure is the supplied {@link Type} itself
498   *
499   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
500   *
501   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple
502   * threads.
503   *
504   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
505   */
506  public static final Class<?> erase(final Type type) {
507    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
508    // 4.6. Type Erasure
509    //
510    // Type erasure is a mapping from types (possibly including
511    // parameterized types and type variables) to types (that are
512    // never parameterized types or type variables). We write |T| for
513    // the erasure of type T. The erasure mapping is defined as
514    // follows:
515    //
516    // The erasure of a parameterized type (§4.5) G<T1,…,Tn> is |G|.
517    //
518    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is |T|.C.
519    //
520    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[].
521    //
522    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
523    // leftmost bound.
524    //
525    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself.
526    if (type == null) {
527      return null;
528    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
529      return erase(c);
530    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
531      return erase(p);
532    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
533      return erase(g);
534    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
535      return erase(tv);
536    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
537      return erase(w);
538    } else {
539      return null;
540    }
541  }
542
543  private static final Class<?> erase(final Class<?> type) {
544    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
545    // …
546    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is
547    // |T|.C. [Class.getDeclaringClass() returns an already erased
548    // type.]
549    //
550    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [A Class that is an
551    // array has a Class as its component type, and that is already
552    // erased.]
553    // …
554    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself. [So in all
555    // cases we can just return the supplied Class<?>.]
556    return type;
557  }
558
559  private static final Class<?> erase(final ParameterizedType type) {
560    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
561    // …
562    // The erasure of a parameterized type (§4.5) G<T1,…,Tₙ> is |G|
563    // [|G| means the erasure of G, i.e. the erasure of
564    // type.getRawType()].
565    return erase(type.getRawType());
566  }
567
568  private static final Class<?> erase(final GenericArrayType type) {
569    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
570    //
571    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [|T| means the
572    // erasure of T. We erase the genericComponentType() and use
573    // Class#arrayType() to find the "normal" array class for the
574    // erasure.]
575    final Class<?> componentType = erase(type.getGenericComponentType());
576    if (componentType == null) {
577      return null;
578    } else {
579      return componentType.arrayType();
580    }
581  }
582
583  private static final Class<?> erase(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
584    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
585    //
586    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
587    // leftmost bound. [In the case of a TypeVariable<?> that returns
588    // multiple bounds, we know they will start with a class, not an
589    // interface and not a type variable.]
590    final Type[] bounds = type.getBounds();
591    return bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
592  }
593
594  private static final Class<?> erase(final WildcardType type) {
595    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
596    //
597    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
598    // leftmost bound.  [WildcardTypes aren't really in the JLS per se
599    // but they behave like type variables. Only upper bounds will
600    // matter here.]
601    final Type[] bounds = type.getUpperBounds();
602    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
603  }
604
605  /**
606   * Tests two {@link Type}s for equality in a manner that is
607   * independent of their implementations.
608   *
609   * @param type0 the first {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
610   *
611   * @param type1 the second {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
612   *
613   * @return {@code true} if the two {@link Type}s are equal; {@code
614   * false} otherwise
615   *
616   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
617   * threads.
618   *
619   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
620   */
621  public static final boolean equals(final Type type0, final Type type1) {
622    if (type0 == null) {
623      return type1 == null;
624    } else if (type1 == null) {
625      return false;
626    } else if (type0 == type1) {
627      return true;
628    } else if (type0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
629      return type1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
630    } else if (type0 instanceof ParameterizedType p0) {
631      return type1 instanceof ParameterizedType p1 && equals(p0, p1);
632    } else if (type0 instanceof GenericArrayType g0) {
633      return type1 instanceof GenericArrayType g1 && equals(g0, g1);
634    } else if (type0 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv0) {
635      return type1 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv1 && equals(tv0, tv1);
636    } else if (type0 instanceof WildcardType w0) {
637      return type1 instanceof WildcardType w1 && equals(w0, w1);
638    } else {
639      return Objects.equals(type0, type1);
640    }
641  }
642
643  private static final boolean equals(final Type[] ts0, final Type[] ts1) {
644    if (ts0 == null) {
645      return ts1 == null;
646    } else if (ts1 == null) {
647      return false;
648    } else if (ts0 == ts1) {
649      return true;
650    } else if (ts0.length == ts1.length) {
651      for (final Type t0 : ts0) {
652        for (final Type t1 : ts1) {
653          if (!equals(t0, t1)) {
654            return false;
655          }
656        }
657      }
658      return true;
659    } else {
660      return false;
661    }
662  }
663
664  private static final boolean equals(final Class<?> c0, final Class<?> c1) {
665    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
666  }
667
668  private static final boolean equals(final ParameterizedType pt0, final ParameterizedType pt1) {
669    if (pt0 == null) {
670      return pt1 == null;
671    } else if (pt1 == null) {
672      return false;
673    } else if (pt0 == pt1) {
674      return true;
675    } else {
676      return
677        equals(pt0.getOwnerType(), pt1.getOwnerType()) &&
678        equals(pt0.getRawType(), pt1.getRawType()) &&
679        equals(pt0.getActualTypeArguments(), pt1.getActualTypeArguments());
680    }
681  }
682
683  private static final boolean equals(final GenericArrayType ga0, final GenericArrayType ga1) {
684    if (ga0 == null) {
685      return ga1 == null;
686    } else if (ga1 == null) {
687      return false;
688    } else if (ga0 == ga1) {
689      return true;
690    } else {
691      return equals(ga0.getGenericComponentType(), ga1.getGenericComponentType());
692    }
693  }
694
695  private static final boolean equals(final TypeVariable<?> tv0, final TypeVariable<?> tv1) {
696    if (tv0 == null) {
697      return tv1 == null;
698    } else if (tv1 == null) {
699      return false;
700    } else if (tv0 == tv1) {
701      return true;
702    } else {
703      return
704        equals(tv0.getGenericDeclaration(), tv1.getGenericDeclaration()) &&
705        Objects.equals(tv0.getName(), tv1.getName());
706    }
707  }
708
709  private static final boolean equals(final GenericDeclaration gd0, final GenericDeclaration gd1) {
710    if (gd0 == null) {
711      return gd1 == null;
712    } else if (gd1 == null) {
713      return false;
714    } else if (gd0 == gd1) {
715      return true;
716    } else if (gd0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
717      return gd1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
718    } else if (gd0 instanceof Executable e0) {
719      return gd1 instanceof Executable e1 && equals(e0, e1);
720    } else {
721      return Objects.equals(gd0, gd1);
722    }
723  }
724
725  private static final boolean equals(final Executable e0, final Executable e1) {
726    if (e0 == null) {
727      return e1 == null;
728    } else if (e1 == null) {
729      return false;
730    } else if (e0 == e1) {
731      return true;
732    } else if (e0 instanceof Constructor<?> c0) {
733      return e1 instanceof Constructor<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
734    } else if (e0 instanceof Method m0) {
735      return e1 instanceof Method m1 && equals(m0, m1);
736    } else {
737      return Objects.equals(e0, e1);
738    }
739  }
740
741  private static final boolean equals(final Constructor<?> c0, final Constructor<?> c1) {
742    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
743  }
744
745  private static final boolean equals(final Method m0, final Method m1) {
746    return Objects.equals(m0, m1);
747  }
748
749  private static final boolean equals(final WildcardType w0, final WildcardType w1) {
750    if (w0 == null) {
751      return w1 == null;
752    } else if (w1 == null) {
753      return false;
754    } else if (w0 == w1) {
755      return true;
756    } else {
757      return
758        equals(w0.getLowerBounds(), w1.getLowerBounds()) &&
759        equals(w0.getUpperBounds(), w1.getUpperBounds());
760    }
761  }
762
763  /**
764   * Computes and returns a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type} independent of
765   * its implementation.
766   *
767   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in
768   * which case {@code 0} will be returned
769   *
770   * @return a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}
771   *
772   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
773   * threads.
774   *
775   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
776   */
777  public static final int hashCode(final Type type) {
778    if (type == null) {
779      return 0;
780    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
781      return hashCode(c);
782    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
783      return hashCode(p);
784    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
785      return hashCode(g);
786    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
787      return hashCode(tv);
788    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
789      return hashCode(w);
790    } else {
791      return type.hashCode();
792    }
793  }
794
795  private static final int hashCode(final Class<?> type) {
796    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
797  }
798
799  private static final int hashCode(final ParameterizedType type) {
800    if (type == null) {
801      return 0;
802    } else {
803      return Arrays.hashCode(type.getActualTypeArguments()) ^ hashCode(type.getOwnerType()) ^ hashCode(type.getRawType());
804    }
805  }
806
807  private static final int hashCode(final GenericArrayType type) {
808    return type == null ? 0 : Objects.hashCode(type.getGenericComponentType());
809  }
810
811  private static final int hashCode(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
812    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
813  }
814
815  private static final int hashCode(final WildcardType type) {
816    return type == null ? 0 : Arrays.hashCode(type.getUpperBounds()) ^ Arrays.hashCode(type.getLowerBounds());
817  }
818
819  /**
820   * Returns a {@link String} representation of the supplied {@link
821   * Type} that is independent of its implementation.
822   *
823   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
824   *
825   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in which
826   * case "{@code null}" will be returned
827   *
828   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of the
829   * supplied {@link Type}
830   *
831   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
832   *
833   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
834   * threads.
835   *
836   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
837   */
838  public static final String toString(final Type type) {
839    if (type == null) {
840      return "null";
841    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
842      return toString(c);
843    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
844      return toString(p);
845    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
846      return toString(g);
847    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
848      return toString(tv);
849    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
850      return toString(w);
851    } else {
852      return type.getTypeName();
853    }
854  }
855
856  private static final String toString(final Class<?> c) {
857    return c == null ? "null" : c.getTypeName();
858  }
859
860  private static final String toString(final ParameterizedType ptype) {
861    if (ptype == null) {
862      return "null";
863    } else {
864      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
865      final Type ownerType = ptype.getOwnerType();
866      if (ownerType == null) {
867        sb.append(toString(ptype.getRawType()));
868      } else {
869        sb.append(toString(ownerType)).append("$");
870        final Type rawType = ptype.getRawType();
871        if (ownerType instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
872          sb.append(toString(rawType).replace(toString(p.getRawType()) + "$", ""));
873        } else if (rawType instanceof Class<?> c) {
874          sb.append(c.getSimpleName());
875        } else {
876          sb.append(toString(rawType));
877        }
878      }
879      final Type[] actualTypeArguments = ptype.getActualTypeArguments();
880      if (actualTypeArguments != null && actualTypeArguments.length > 0) {
881        final StringJoiner stringJoiner = new StringJoiner(", ", "<", ">");
882        stringJoiner.setEmptyValue("");
883        for (final Type actualTypeArgument : actualTypeArguments) {
884          stringJoiner.add(toString(actualTypeArgument));
885        }
886        sb.append(stringJoiner.toString());
887      }
888      return sb.toString();
889    }
890  }
891
892  private static final String toString(final GenericArrayType gatype) {
893    if (gatype == null) {
894      return "null";
895    } else {
896      return toString(gatype.getGenericComponentType()) + "[]";
897    }
898  }
899
900  private static final String toString(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
901    return tv == null ? "null" : tv.getName();
902  }
903
904  private static final String toString(final WildcardType wc) {
905    if (wc == null) {
906      return "null";
907    } else {
908      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("?");
909      Type[] bounds = wc.getLowerBounds();
910      if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0) {
911        // Upper bounds only.
912        bounds = wc.getUpperBounds();
913        if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0 || Object.class.equals(bounds[0])) {
914          bounds = null;
915        } else {
916          sb.append(" extends ");
917        }
918      } else {
919        // Lower bounds only.
920        sb.append(" super ");
921      }
922      if (bounds != null) {
923        assert bounds.length > 0;
924        final StringJoiner sj = new StringJoiner(" & ");
925        for (final Type bound: bounds) {
926          sj.add(String.valueOf(toString(bound)));
927        }
928        sb.append(sj.toString());
929      }
930      return sb.toString();
931    }
932  }
933
934}
